routing

Class MaxPropRouter.MaxPropComparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • routing.MaxPropRouter.MaxPropComparator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<Message>
    Enclosing class:
    MaxPropRouter

    private class MaxPropRouter.MaxPropComparator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<Message>
    Message comparator for the MaxProp routing module. Messages that have a hop count smaller than the given threshold are given priority and they are ordered by their hop count. Other messages are ordered by their delivery cost.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MaxPropComparator

        public MaxPropComparator(int treshold)
        Constructor. Assumes that the host where all the costs are calculated from is this router's host.
        Parameters:
        treshold - Messages with the hop count smaller than this value are transferred first (and ordered by the hop count)

      • MaxPropComparator

                         DTNHost from1,
                         DTNHost from2)

        Parameters:
        treshold - Messages with the hop count smaller than this value are transferred first (and ordered by the hop count)
        from1 - The host where the cost of msg1 is calculated from
        from2 - The host where the cost of msg2 is calculated from

    • Method Detail

      • compare

        public int compare(Message msg1,
                   Message msg2)
        Compares two messages and returns -1 if the first given message should be first in order, 1 if the second message should be first or 0 if message order can't be decided. If both messages' hop count is less than the threshold, messages are compared by their hop count (smaller is first). If only other's hop count is below the threshold, that comes first. If both messages are below the threshold, the one with smaller cost (determined by MaxPropRouter.getCost(DTNHost, DTNHost)) is first.
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<Message>
